TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {31688=AS A JUNIOR IN 2003: Started all 24 matches... led the team in scoring with 17 points, coming on seven goals and three assists... took a conference-high 62 shots, 21 of which were on goal... led the Broncos with four game-winning goals... scored first goal in the season opener against Alabama A&M... scored in victories over both Sacramento State and Gonzaga... scored the game winning goal in 3-1 victory over No. 9 SMU... scored on successful penalty kicks against George Washington and No. 17 San Diego... tallied game-winning goal in 3-2 overtime win over Coastal Carolina in NCAA Tournament... assisted on two goals in the regular season, one in the win over George Washington and the other in the 2-1 victory over Saint Mary's... also assisted on first goal in the win over Coastal Carolina... named to the All-WCC first team... also named to the College Cup All-Tournament Team after taking four shots in the national semifinal match... earned LMU Fall Classic All-Tournament team honors for his play against No. 9 SMU and No. 7 Creighton... earned First Team District VIII All-Academic honors from CoSIDA... selected to WCC All-Academic first team... named WCC Player of the Week on November 10., 34456=PERSONAL: Born on Christmas day 1982 in Redmond, Wash... parents are Lon and Darlene Weatherly of Bellevue, Wash... has one brother named All-Classic Team (9/12/04) SCU/adidas Classic All-Classic Team (9/18/04), 33886=HIGH SCHOOL: A 2001 graduate of Newport High School in Bellevue, Wash... was a letterwinner at the 3A powerhouse, playing for head coach Paul Mendes... a member of the 1998 and 2000 league championships teams... team advanced to state finals in '98... earned All-League and All-Area honors during junior and senior seasons... was team's leading scorer for three consecutive seasons being sophomore season... was on Newport's Honor Roll three consecutive years... garnered the school's Community Service Award.  , 30426=AS A SENIOR IN 2004: One of only two Broncos to start all 21 matches... one of the team's co-captains... First Team All-WCC honoree... took 27 shots, 11 of which were on goal... ranked fourth on the team with eight points on the season... scored two goals and assisted on four others... started the season with a bang, recording a goal and two assists at the diadora Classic over Labor Day weekend... assisted on the third goal of the match in SCU's 3-0 season opening victory over UMass... scored first goal of the year and assisted on another in 4-1 victory over UC Davis... earned All-diadora Classic honors for his performance in the two matches... added second goal of the season in 3-0 victory over Davidson in the SCU/adidas Classic on September 18... named to the All-adidas Classic Team... picked up All-GMU/Comfort Inn Classic honors after leading the Broncos to the tournament title... assisted on game-winning goal in 2-1 victory over Saint Mary's on Halloween night... also assisted on a game-winning goal against Gonzaga on November 5... Third Team ESPN Academic All-American... earned second straight All-District VIII Academic All-American honors as a senior ... a member of the WCC Commissioner's Honor Roll.}
textBeforeTable: Waetherly's Career Statistics   PERSONAL: Born on Christmas day 1982 in Redmond, Wash... parents are Lon and Darlene Weatherly of Bellevue, Wash... has one brother named Ross and one sister named Tricia... majoring in accounting. HIGH SCHOOL: A 2001 graduate of Newport High School in Bellevue, Wash... was a letterwinner at the 3A powerhouse, playing for head coach Paul Mendes... a member of the 1998 and 2000 league championships teams... team advanced to state finals in '98... earned All-League and All-Area honors during junior and senior seasons... was team's leading scorer for three consecutive seasons being sophomore season... was on Newport's Honor Roll three consecutive years... garnered the school's Community Service Award.   AS A FRESHMAN IN 2001: Appeared in 14 matches as a freshman, starting one of those contests... took 12 shots, two of which were on goal... his 12 shots was the second highest freshman total on the team, trailing only Ryan Cochrane. AS A SOPHOMORE IN 2002: Started in 14 of the 17 matches he appeared in... took 26 shots on the season, 15 of which were on goal... scored five goals and assisted on one other... finished second on the team in goals scored and in points (11)... scored the game-winning goal in the 2-0 victory against San Jose State... notched other four goals against Notre Dame de Namur, Cal State Fullerton, Brown and Loyola Marymount... team went 4-0-1 in games in which he scored... lone assist of the year came on the team's fifth
textAfterTable: Weatherly's Career Honors: First Team All-WCC 2003 First Team All-WCC 2004 2003 All-College Cup Team Third Team ESPN Academic All-American 2004 First Team All-Academic WCC 2003 First Team CoSIDA District VIII Academic All-American (2003) First Team CoSIDA District VIII Academic All-American (2004) GMU/Comfort Inn Classic All-Classic Team (9/12/04) SCU/adidas Classic All-Classic Team (9/18/04) All Access Team Santa Clara
